Name: Monopoly: Neuchâtel
Description:
Neuchâtel is a French-speaking canton, located in French-speaking Switzerland. It can be represented in four major regions. Along Lake Neuchâtel is the region called Littoral. The city of Neuchâtel is established on the right bank of the lake. To the north, passing through the Chaumont, is the Val-de-Ruz.

West of Neuchâtel, still in the Littoral, is the alluvial cone of the mouth of the Areuse. The valley narrows further to the west in a narrow gorge and then opens onto the Val-de-Travers. The Canton of Neuchâtel is also the cradle of the most prestigious watch brands.

Don't forget, like in any other Monopoly, do not get bankrupted to win !

Name: Go Master: Youtubers
Description:
A board game about controlling your own YouTube channel and reach the most subscribers - who will reach the 100.000 first?

The game consists of a number of challenges, that must be dealt with to advance in the game. Move up form "Noob" to "Pro" to "top-creator" and end the game by creating an unforgettable story to your YouTube channel to become the master YouTuber.

Watch out for trolls by your opponents during the game.

There's also a free app to the game.

Name: Tribal Souls
Description:
Strategic game inspired by Native American legends.
Beautiful mechanics for a game balance that goes beyond even randomness.

1-6 players.
1 hour of play.

The goal will be to dispel the Anamaqkiu and become the most popular tribe of the descendants of Honiahaka (Little Wolf). To do this you will have to find artifacts or get help from the souls of the dead that your tribe will suffer, and invoke so powerful spirits. An "Area Movement" strategic game but with an advanced "Set Collection" heart thanks to multifunctional cards, combined with a "Pattern Building".

—description from the designer

Name: Battles For Athelon
Description:
Battles for Athelon is an RTS-type game, it takes place in a fantastic world called Athelon where many races coexist, and each one has its own attributes and abilities. Each player must use their actions (which are the workers) to improve their settlement, having to build different buildings that will give them types of units, additional skills and powers to achieve victory, each game has a goal to meet, once it is reached. For this objective the game ends and the point count begins, each building, unit, battle, resource, and other things that are done in the game have a point value; the player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Coin Curling
Description:
Coin Curling is a board game for people who like sports. It is a fast-moving tabletop game of skill, dramatic comebacks, and good-natured competition.

Coin Curling is easy to learn. First - spin the coin. Second - while the coin is still spinning, tap the coin one time toward the center. Third - the team with their coin closest to the center scores.

After all 8 coins have been played, the "end" is over, and the team with the coin closest to the center scores. They get 1 point for every coin that is closer that the other team's closest coin, and the other team gets 0 points. A recreational game goes to 5 ends and can be played in as little as 20 minutes.

If you can spin a coin, you can play Coin Curling. Coin Curling is great for adults, but it is also fun for the whole family ages 8 and up. You can play individual 1-on-1, and a full team game is 2-on-2.

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly: Louvre
Description:
Be the first to buy a Louvre masterpiece!

Organize exhibitions and attract as many visitors as possible over the course of the game.
Outbid your opponents during auctions and negotiate artworks that you wish to acquire.
In a word, take risks, clinch art deals and win the game.

The Musée du Louvre throws open the doors of its collections !
It's up to you to get people to come and discover world-class artworks.
Organize exhibitions at home or around the world with Michelangelo's Dying Slave or the Law Code of Hammurabi.

--description from publisher
Families: Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: The 'Nam: The Way it Was
Description:
By using simple to understand mechanics, such as playing cards and 'dice shifting', it is possible to simulate any of the troops who did the fightin` and a-dyin` a long way away from home or amongst their own cities and villages.

The rules attempt to embrace all the combatants who played a part in the war on both sides, from the Viet Cong guerrilla to the contributions made by Australia, South Korea and others (see 'Falling Dominoes' supplement).

The aim is the use of 28mm-sized figures, but 15 - 20mm miniatures may also be used with no real changes needing to be made.

The game is focused upon platoon level actions, although it should be possible to scale up or down as required (company to rifle squad).

—description from the publisher

Name: Wild Geese: Living on the Front Line
Description:
Wild Geese: living on the front line, Mercenary Units In Action Around The World, 1960’s To The 1990’s.

The life of a mercenary depends upon the accounts you read or your approach to the topic. On one level, mercenary life can seem romantic, an adventure, where often noble Soldiers of Fortune venture forth to save lives, right wrongs and vanquish the evil within our world. On another, mercenary life can appear fraught with danger, hardship and eventual death, with little or no support from uncaring employers. The truth is, the reality can be seen as a blend of these and many other factors. What is known is that mercenaries in one form or another have been instrumental in toppling governments, creating nations and preserving peace / ensuring war across the globe, especially during the post-1945 period and up until the modern day.

The information and rules within this book are designed to reflect the life of a mercenary unit during this tumultuous period within many regions and countries. It blends fact and fiction to create a simple, workable framework within which tabletop units and battles can be created in a range of circumstances. 
It is designed to be a skirmish level game using suitable miniatures from 15 to 28mm size, plus buildings, vehicles and other items that are scaled to fit. 
Games can represent one-off encounters or be a part of a series of battles, perhaps even a narrative campaign where the units you and your fellow gamers come up with develop over time.

Remember: Get in, get out, get paid -
where the Wild Geese roam, lesser men fear to tread…

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Pass The Biscuits
Description: Teams must try to guess the words written on biscuit cards. There are three rounds in the game. The first round, you describe the words. The second, you mime out the words. The third, you can only use a one word clue.

Name: Wargaming the Sugar Islands Campaign: A Guide to the British Expedition to Martinique and Guadeloupe in 1759
Description:
Wargaming the Sugar Islands Campaign is a guide to the British Invasion of Martinique and Guadeloupe.

It contains a detailed summary of the events on both islands, the leaders, the forces involved and the islands themselves.

There is information on suitable figures, scenery and rule sets to use and loads of period maps detailing the landing areas and land fought over.

The book also contains 6 scenarios each with a detailed colour layout and with special rules including a simple campaign and special events.

Contents:

     Background to the Campaign
     The voyage to the Islands
     Martinique
     Scenarios for Martinique
     Guadeloupe
     The Actions on Guadeloupe 
     The End of the Campaign
     Aftermath
     Scenarios for Guadeloupe
     Notes for Wargames
     Bibliography


—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: FC Basel 1893
Description:
On November 15, 1893, eleven interested readers of the Basler Nationalzeitung met to be shoe makers in the Basler pub of the guild, including members of a rowing club, academics and a sports journalist (who translated the football rules from English) and decided to found the FC Basel. The club colors were kept in red and blue. Just eleven days later, the club's first game took place on the freshly set up Landhof sports field.

In 1953, FC Basel celebrated the first championship title in the club's history with just one defeat out of 26 games. In the Benthaus era, FC Basel won 7 championship titles and 2 cups. In the Benthaus era, legends such as
Karl Odermatt and Othmar Hitzfeld.

Many unsuccessful years followed, including relegation to the NLB in 1988. After rising again, FC Basel gained new strengths under the presidents René C. Jäggi, Gigi Oehri and Bernhard Heusler and has dominated Swiss football since the early 2000s and enjoys great international recognition.

Experience FC Basel in a new way with the first edition of Monopoly FC Basel.

Name: The GemShine Pylons
Description:
The empire needs power! But not all power is created equal – different gems have different uses, and so you must construct gem-powered Pylons that will be used by the most people. The better you do, the more the empire will reward you. Making them attractive as well will increase your favor among the nobility.

During the game you will buy multi-use cards from a market - often leaving gems behind to pay for them. If there's nothing you want to buy, you can gather all the gems from the market to clear it and fill it with new options. Cards have immediate effects, like building pylons or inserting gems in them for points, but they also have attributes which affect the value of those gems at the end of the game. Even seemingly small choices can have big results!

The player who scores the most points, wins! Co-op and solo modes are included as well, to expand your options for play.

-description from designer

Name: Bougainville: The Forgotten Campaign
Description: Interesting and beautiful little game. Few pieces with well thought out and easy rules. Similar to a game of chess, more complex than it seems.

Name: Vengeance: Hero Pack – Selena
Description:
Selena was dating Johnny Silver’s daughter, Manu, when the bastard Tengu-Kai kidnapped her to get leverage on Johnny. What they didn’t anticipate is that her girlfriend would turn out to be such a hard-arse, athletic fighter that would give them yet another headache, on top of Johnny Silver’s tactical onslaughts. I guess they messed with the wrong punk-bar

Selena’s ability, perks and solo mission focus on the acquisition and manipulation of Wild Tokens on dens. Like Napoleone her stats are slightly weaker than the rest, but her ability more than makes up for it.

Hero Pack Includes:

• 1 Selena Miniature
 • 9 Montage Cards
 • 1 Hero Player Board
 • 1 Solo Mission Card

Name: Chummy
Description:
Chummy consists of two games: Chummy Chess and Chummy Checkers.

Chummy Chess can be played by two or four players on the same circular game board. Each player commands a complete set of traditional chessmen. The chessmen are moved in a manner similar to traditional 2-player chess. While the original theme of chess has been maintained, Chummy adds several new dimensions which include circular moving, board control, team play, inheriting chessmen, and much more. To win in Chummy, a player must capture all of the opponent’s kings, or use his/her king to control the center of the game board.

Name: WHAAAT?
Description:
WHAAAT?

A communication game by Nicolas Normandon, illustrated by Pierô, in which you have to make your team mates guess the absurd situation you are in.

Stuck in an elevator? Stranded on a deserted island? Unfortunately, you only have a rubber duck, a leak and lots of other superfluous and useless objects to make yourself understood.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Root: The Marauder Expansion
Description:
Root: The Marauder Expansion introduces two new factions to the Woodlandâ —the Lord of the Hundreds and Keepers in Iron—alongside four hirelings and a new setup draft suitable for both casual and competitive play.

Play as the:
- Lord of the Hundreds – Oppress the Woodland and burn it to the ground if need be. You suffer no dissent.
- Keepers in Iron – Lead your exiled order of devout knights into battle to recover ancient relics. For glory!

Discover unique strategies and make the Woodland wilder by adding hirelings! These small factions can be used at any player count and introduce surprising new power combinations as well as a chess-like tension to lower player count games of Root.

- Forest Patrol & Feline Physicians – Secure your realm and heal deadly injuries with Marquise elites.
- Last Dynasty & Bluebird Nobles – Crush your foes and prove your legitimacy with the last Eyrie regiment.
- Spring Uprising & Rabbit Scouts – Revolt against despots and fight for freedom with Alliance sympathizers.
- The Exile & The Bandit – Stalk the forests and steal what you need with these Vagabond mercenaries.

Name: Dice Throne Adventures: Four Horsemen Promo Pack
Description:
Promo Pack for Man vs Meeple's 2020 Kickstarter.

Includes 4 Meeple Mercenary (one of each rarity) and one Four Horsemen stage IV minion.

Name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – CMON Comics: Vol. 1 Promos
Description:
New additions to the game included with the Kickstarter edition of the 132-page "Fight or Flight" graphic novel.

Six new investigator figures and dashboards:

     Lysa
     Jack
     Rocco
     Annabelle
     Allan
     Tamara


Four new cultist cards:

     Mad Cultist
     Pyro Cultist
     Zealous Cultist
     Reckless Cultist

Name: Spaghetti Western
Description:
“The Wild West witnessed legendary heroes, who imposed Law and Order on flourishing peoples. Before the glitter of their insignia and their pistols, the dirty and violent Outlaws were hunted down and arrested ...

And you are one of them!

Gather your gang, ravage the towns and collect $50... before the other Outlaws!"

Spaghetti Western is a Mr. Exes game for 2 to 4 players, where each one must assemble a band of Outlaws and be the first, at the end of a Round, to have at least $50.

Players will visit a different town each day, where they can take Legal Actions (buy, sell, etc.) and of course many illegal ones (robberies!) By making the price go up in their heads. You must also gather a band and that it has a Chief. And always be careful not to lose outlaws in duels, arrested, sentenced to hang, or because they were not fed at the end of the Day!

—description from the designer

Name: The Last Drifters: Objects in the Rearview May Kill You
Description:
The Last Drifters
These rules are meant for any small scale cars made by any manufacturer (as long as both forces are of a similar scale). 
The vehicles used as examples in these rules are cheap converted children's cars that you can find in most toy shops, and the games are aimed at using around two to three vehicles per side for a normal game of maybe an hour or so. The system can cope with more vehicles per side but these games would take longer to play.

The rules cover a selection of vehicles that you would expect to find in a post apocalyptic world, from fast motorbikes all the way up to heavy battle trucks. The rules also cover many different weapons and armour that these vehicles could possibly carry.

These rules also contain a selection of ways to play, plus a section containing a few scenarios like:

     Resting Beside The Road - a couple of drifters are taking a rest beside the road when they hear ganger motorbikes!
     Find The Lady - a VIP is travelling in one of the cars can you get them to safety?
     Plus a few others.


At the back of these rules you will find a print out section with the data sheets for all the basic

Vehicles and some blank ones so that you can build your own vehicles. You will also find all of the counters for you to use in your games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Egyptian Kings
Description:
The Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Egyptian Kings expansion is the fourth expansion in the line and introduces two brand new faction decks to the game.

The Hatshepsut deck is a clan located on the Nile Delta, with the deck being designed around that core concept. The faction introduces a new mechanism of assigning workers to Field cards to make them more fertile and effective.

The Amenhotep deck is designed around the concept of the passing of centuries, the sands of time. Locations in the deck will decline and get discarded at the end of the round if the player won’t spend resources to keep the card in the Empire.

Name: Diced Cheese
Description:
Diced Cheese is an addictively fun dice game that can be played by 1-10 people ages 5+, and typically takes 15-20 mins to play. We created this game to be simple, yet competitive with no need for math, pencils, or scorecards. The packaged game is small enough to take and play anywhere. Throw it in your backpack for your next camping trip. Keep it in your bike pouch, glove box, purse OR swap out your Copenhagen or on your Charcuterie board ready for family game night. This game is full of highs and lows as you navigate the waters of NO GOUDAs and LEANING TOWERS OF CHEESAs to compete against friends and family to be the first to complete the wheel of cheese three times.

—description from the designer

Name: Subbuteo: 5 vs 5 Indoor
Description:
Reimplementation of the classic soccer flicking game with a smaller playing pitch of similar felt-like sliding surface. The playing field comes already mounted on a very light foam-like material surrounded by walls. Goals are attachable plastic made frames with nets. Comes with teams of five players each painted with the colors of Spain and Brazil.

—user summary

Name: Burbuja
Description:
Solitaire game for Piecepack in which a 5x5 square must expand into a hollow 7x7 square in 24 moves or less. The level of difficulty is adjustable by allowing second chances at certain moves.

The game will be won if the full square can be blown up as if it was a bubble (Spanish: â€‹burbuja) in no more than 24 moves.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ada Lovelace: Legacy of the Analytical Engine
Description:
"EXTRA! EXTRA! MR X STRIKES AGAIN! In a clear statement that no museum is safe from his mechanisms, Mr X has pilfered from yet another British institute of history..."

Ada Lovelace: Legacy of the Analytical Engine is a solitaire roll-and-write legacy game, following our protagonist, Ada Lovelace, as she chases the elusive Mr X around the globe. Over the course of 9 levels, players will examine crime scenes, upgrade their skills, and try to thwart Mr X's evil plans.

Each turn, the player rolls two dice and uses them in one of two ways:


     To place polyominoes on a crime scene in order to search rooms or collect evidence.
     To trigger insight abilities from the various pieces of collected evidence. Abilities might let the player take bonus moves, fill in more parts of the crime scene, score points, unlock permanent upgrades, etc.


After 15 turns, the player's skills are assessed and, depending on how they performed, they can pick from a variety of permanent upgrades to power-up Ada Lovelace's abilities. This might be new polyomino shapes, long-term abilities, or other rule-changing twists.

Each level also provides it's own twists on the rules, with unique rules, evidence abilities, layouts, locked areas, folded sheets, overlapping areas, multiple floors, etc. Tacking Mr X will require the player to navigate all these twists and complexities!

-description from designer

Name: Vous êtes dans une Auberge
Description:
After exploring Dungeons filled with traps, facing Trolls & Dragons, and saved many Princesses, four Adventurers decided to relax in a Inn of the neighbourhood.

Once at the counter, they are greeted by  Kurt the Innkeeper, who will serve them the best beverages of his  establishment and enjoin them to spend the best evening possible.

Drink shots, meet customers, visit the inn, spend your gold! This is the program of the evening.

But the adventurers will be wary of each other, will avoid spending all their money and make sure not to attract the wrath of Igor and Stan, the two bouncers of the Inn. Only an adventurer as wise as festive can boast to be the one who has spent the best evening!

Goal :

It's up to you to collect "Inn" cards to score the most points in order to win the game.

But be careful, having the most cards does not guarantee victory. Make sure you get the most valuable ones.

Principles of "Vous êtes dans une Auberge":

Each player embodies one of the four  adventurers of the game: The Knight, The Dwarf, The Elf and The Hobbit;  each with their own money and talents.

In turn, the players will first go to the  counter to order "drink" cards thanks to their purse money. Each  purchase will allow them to also acquire "Sympathy" cards.

Then they will spend a good time acquiring  "Inn" cards thanks to the various drinks and coins in their possession.  Each "Inn" card has a value in victory points that will be counted at  the end of the game.

Each player may also use "Skills" cards  available to help his Adventurer to win, but also to prevent other  players from reaching their goal.

All will have to pay attention to not abuse of drinks! To own too many  "Drink" cards may attract the attention of  the bouncers, Igor and Stan, who will put you out unceremoniously!

Players will need to think about keeping money  and "Sympathy" tokens to help them get out of tricky situations, or  even sacrifice cards to stay in the running.

The first player to buy 6 "Inn" cards  starts the last turn of play. Those who have not played yet complete  their turn, then each player counts the victory points recorded on the  "Inn" cards in his possession.

The player with the highest score wins the game.

— description from the publisher.

Name: Pretpark Tempo
Description:
In Pretpark Tempo you build your own theme park and try to accommodate to the wishes of potential visitors as good as possible. Will you manage to attract more visitors than the other players?

Pretpark Tempo is a card-drafting game with a unique twist. Cards can be played as an attraction or as a potential visitor.

The game consists of two phases. The first phase lasts two rounds. Every turn each player chooses two cards form their hand and then pass the remaining cards to an adjacent player. All players simultaneously show which card they play as an attraction, place it in front of them and activate its special ability. All build attractions stay in play in front of each player to form their own theme park. Attractions all have a type and a theme which contribute to attracting visitors in the second phase of the game. The second card chosen is placed face-down in a shared pile which is called "the visitors' row". All visitors in this pile will make their appearance in the second phase of the game to choose a theme park to visit.

Whenever one or more players have no cards to pass to an adjacent player - the round ends. A new hand of cards is dealt to each player and a new round starts. After two rounds the first phase of the game comes to an end.

In the second phase of the game the visitors in the visitor' row are revealed one by one. All visitors have a preference toward a certain theme and type of attraction. Players compare their theme parks to find out who has a majority in attractions that are preferred by the visitor to decide which player attracts the visitor. After all visitors are assigned you count how many visitors came to visit your park and add bonus points for your attractions with certain special abilities. The player with the most points wins the game.

Pretpark Tempo is a contest for majorities. Therefore, it is essential to keep close track of what your opponents are building and make well-considered decisions during the drafts. It plays best with 3-5 players but also contains a solid ruleset for a 2-player game and a solo variant.

-description from designer

Name: Hoodwink
Description: A trick taker of shifting alliances, in which partners try to win the same number of tricks as each other, and a soloist tries to sabotage them.

Name: Squarcles
Description:
squarcle*, (skwair-cul), n, a graphic symbol consisting of three elements, where each element is either a square or a circle and is either black or white.

Squarcles is a symbol recognition game in which players try to be the quickest to spot the correct squarcle among all the squarcles on the card.

The game uses just 1 card! 
You'll also need 4 dice and some tokens for scoring (or a pen and paper).

* I coined this word :)

—description from the designer

Name: Dada's Cup
Description:
Win the Dada's Cup with your horse racing team consisting of one horse or more horses by competing in the different racing programs (from one to nine depending on the chosen program, flat, obstacle, trot).

During each competition, points are awarded according to the difficulty of the race and the horse's rankings at the finish.

Whichever player obtains the most points accumulated at the end of the last race wins the "Dada's Cup" Trophy.

Contents:

     1 board for the racecourse with its track.
     12 horse pieces and 12 colored bases.
     12 Owner cards representing the horses.
     108 Acceleration cards.
     2x 6-faced dice.
     1 blue Mode dice.
     1 red Points dice.

Name: UpLinks
Description:
UpLinks is a simple polyominoes stacking game for 2 to 4 players plus a solo mode. Sort of like 3D dominoes with dice.

Players roll dice, match, stack and balance polyomino-shaped wooden pieces. Pieces can be linked adjacently or laid on top of another matching piece.

Two pieces must match the die roll. For example, rolling 3-4 means you must align an existing piece with a 3 to a piece with a 4. The two numbers must be either adjacently next to each other or on top of one another.

The challenge is to get rid of all or most of your pieces to win. The player with the lowest value of unplayable pieces wins.

Configurable modes for easy to difficult challenges.
You can play with a 3x3 stack or 5x5 base.

Colourful, precision-lasercut wooden pieces.

-description from designer

Name: What the F*ck!
Description:
What the fuck ! is a politically incorrect and sassy party game. 
Its nomadic format makes it easy to take anywhere with you.

An adult game of questions and answers in which you will have to try to keep your composure in the face of unsettling questions.

Don't blush!

Content: 140 cards, 1 hourglass, 1 dice, the rules of the game.

Name: Bet Your Word
Description:
Bet Your Word is a poker-like word game where you try to make the best-scoring words.

Using letters in your hand and the central one showing, form your best word and bet to see if it is better than that of your opponent(s).

SETUP: 
1. Shuffle the cards and place into a draw pile.
2. Give each player an equal number of coins.
3. Give each player five cards to hold in secret.
 
GAME PLAY: 
On each turn:
• A player flips over the next card from the draw pile
• Each player antes one “cent”
• Each player attempts to visualize a word using a combination of the central card any number of letters in their hand
• Any player can then bet a coin
• All players who wish to bet their word, must match the bet and can raise their bet as well
• When betting stops, the players reveal their words
• The player with the highest point value gathers all the letters played, all the coins and the central card
• Players can then replace up to five cards from the draw pile
• Players must maintain exactly five cards in their hands

Play continues with the next player on the left.

The game ends when no more cards can be drawn. At this point players add up their coin values and letter values to determine the winner. If there is a tie, the youngest player wins.

Two additional modes are possible.
Solo mode and "Multiple Choice" betting mode.

The game comes with  
• 90 A-Z letter and bigram fragment cards 
• 50 coins in various cent denominations

The game has two sizes"
2 inch cards in a 2x2x2 box or
full sized deck of 104 cards.

-description from publisher

Name: Champions of Shaleria: Core Deck
Description:
If you like card games, you’ll love Champions of Shaleria! This non-collectible modular game is a complete game in a single box. Each core deck supports 2-4 players and is designed for quick gameplay (10-35 minutes each).

Easy rules, fast gameplay. This non-collectable, fully modular card game lets you take on the role of hero; gathering equipment, casting spells, battling through fierce creatures, and questing your way to victory. Everything you need for 2-4 players in a single deck.

This is a competitive game about earning equipment, slaying monsters, and completing quests. On your turn you choose an action to take, primarily either buying equipment or attacking a monster. The player who slays the correct monsters for their quests first wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Count Me In
Description:
Welcome to Count Me In, the fast-paced card game for the whole family. Between game-changing rules, cards disappearing, and other players out to get you, you’ll never play the same way twice.

Players compete in a steampunk-style game to get rid of their hand of cards. Cards available are number cards (used to increase or decrease the current count piles), direction cards (used to change the direction of the count), and jump cards (used to change the increase or decrease limit of the count).

On their turn, players will play a card onto one of two count piles in play based on the current limitations of that pile. If a player cannot play a card from their hand, they must draw a card and either play the card drawn or remove a non-starter card in play.

At the end of each round, players gain points based on the cards left in their hand. The game ends when a player reaches 500 points; the player with the lowest score wins!

-description from publisher

Name: Монополия: Курск
Description: A revisited version of the classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the city of Kursk in Russia

Name: Where's my luggage?
Description:
You got off the plane, arrived to pick up your luggage and found out it was replaced? Whether you've arrived for a vacation, a business trip or a family visit, you probably have exciting plans for the next few days. But first - don't forget to collect your luggage before leaving the airport! Not as simple as it seems!
A visual memory game that will get you started planning your next destination.

How to Play?

     On each turn, players turn over luggage cards and spin the


conveyor.

     Whenever you find all the suitcases on the passenger tag - you get a passport stamp.
     First player to get 4 passport stamps - wins!

Name: Hideous Abomination: Robots & Rot
Description:
Not hideous enough for you?

Freshen up those stale monstrosities (or push them further into decay) with this expansion that adds new ways to play and deeper strategy to Hideous Abomination! Rot tiles make other tiles useless. Robot tiles are automatically bolted down and resist Rot. It's a disgusting new dimension to the game!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Sekai no Hate made Itte Q!
Description: A trivia board game based on a Japanese TV Show with the same name.

Name: 9DKP: Series 2
Description: Series 2 for 9DKP.

Name: 9DKP: Series 3
Description:
Series 3 for 9DKP Starter Deck Includes:

1. 40 9DKP cards
2. Dice
3. Counter
4. Paper play mat
5. Instruction Booklet

Name: 9DKP: Dungeon Series
Description: The Dungeon Series for 9DPKP.

Name: Stamp Collection Cats
Description:
An auction game of furmidable negotiations for 3-5 players.
As you desperately try to trade your cat stamps with others to build the most valuable collection, the face down cards in the center will slowly reveal which cards are more valuable. Did you predict that the green cat stamps would be pretty valuable this game? Alas, it turns out green cards are worth the fewest points in this auction! Better try and sneakily trade one to another player.

Name: Tateruto
Description:
Summon spirits to your field, gain the mana specific to that spirit, and use that mana to buy and build tower cards. Get 7 tower stories and you win!

Tateruto is a competitive and fleshed out mini-strategy game. You're faced with a choice each turn; summon spirits to use abilities and gain mana, or spend mana to build tower stories and inch closer to winning.

Will you steal mana from your opponent this round and risk their wrath? Or do you play the cutest ghost card ever to save up some mana and hope no one comes for you? The mana pool is limited to just 5 of each color, so you have to plan really well.

Name: The Moon Ant Mow Down at Lunar Base: Dirty Ankle
Description:
The U.S. wants to be the first to colonize the moon, but one small thing stands in its way: MOON ANTS. These moon ants will cause havoc on electrical equipment and must be eliminated before colonization. The U.S. enlists the help of Cleephas Spangler, to rid the moon of these pests. With his 1986 mower, converted to solar power, he will be given the task of vacuuming up all the ants and inject the entire lunar surface with a specialized moon ant killer. All within a day. He will have the usual problems associated with having a mower, combined with the problem of the moon's shadow rending his solar powered mower inoperable.

His one requirement for succeeding in his mission?: Changing the national anthem's name from The Star Spangled Banner to The Star Spangler Banner. Sounds absurd? Wait till you play the game, and you will know its absurd!

Overall winner of the 6th Roll & Write Game Design Contest

—description from the designer

Name: Ice Pack
Description:
Ice Pack is a dice stacking game where you try to match a pattern and score points in a limited time frame. Each turn you will roll the dice, choose a die and a column to place that die. That die will then push the stack down and alter the alignment of each row. Using the score sheet, you will choose a matching pattern and score accordingly.

For the solo game, the goal is to beat your highest score. In the two player game, whoever has the highest score, wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Sancak Taşı
Description:
Sancak TaÅŸÄ± ("Banner Stone") is a chess like boardgame, goal is capture your enemy's flag and bring it to your banner-stone.

Each player has 17 figures. (4 footman, 2 hunter, 2 archer, 2 elephant, 2 cavalery, 2 wall, 1 necromancer, 1 banner and 1 banner-stone)
Player as a commander try to defeat his/her enemy with the help of 94 action cards and a d4 dice.

Name: Wieża imprezowa
Description: It's the new face of classic Jenga, specially for parties. Rules are very alike - you move wooden blocks out of the tower. Each block contains short task you need to perform. The player who knocks off the tower is the loser and everyone else wins. The losing player has to do the task everyone agreed on before playing the game.

Name: Contracts
Description:
Contracts is a 2-4 player card game where you take on the role of a top international hitman. Your mission is to complete more hits than your competitors to become the most Infamous.

Every hitman has a unique skill so be sure to pick a hitman that compliments your playing style.

Each player has a turn drawing a card, playing an action and potentially attempting an assassination.

Contracts takes around 15-25 minutes to play. Rules are simple to pick up and fun for more advanced board/card game players.

—description from the designer

Name: Lille Storm says Hello and Goodbye
Description:
Little Storm says Hello and Goodbye is a memory game for the youngest kids in which you can also talk about saying hello or goodbye to various things.

The game comes with 6 themed player boards, so you can just play it as a memory game, or you can also talk with your kids about for example saying hello to a new baby, saying goodbye and hello when moving or even saying goodbye to life itself at a funeral.

Children get the opportunity to put their own words on the game's boards and cards, which deal with situations the children can relate to or prepares children for events or circumstances that may be difficult.

The box contains 6 game boards, 24 cards and game rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: UpTower
Description:
UpTower is a block-based tower-building roll-and-write game for any number of players (minimum of two). Play is simultaneous and quick, so there's very little down-time. Because it's a free print-and-play roll-and-write, it's easy for distant players to print their own play sheets and play over video chat.

If you're familiar with the classic Russian block-stacking video game or the board game Coppenhagen, you have a good grasp of how UpTower plays. the goal of the game is to build a tower with the highest, largest floor before the end of the game.

At the start of each turn, one player rolls a die. This die tells all players what piece they must “drop” onto their playfield.

After the die roll, play is simultaneous - You place the rolled piece on your playfield at the same time as all other players. To do this, you’ll mark off one of the four “uses” of that piece on the reference side of your play sheet, then you’ll fill in the spaces where they piece “landed” after you “dropped” onto your playfield from the top edge.

Every turn - before or ater you place the rolled piece - you may place one “at will“ piece. If you do, mark off the “at will” dot for the piece you want to place, then drop it on your board like a rolled piece. You may do this once for each of the six pieces. Note that you get a score bonus (up to 21 points) for your unused “at will” pieces at the end of the game, so choose wisely!

Once everyone’s placed their rolled and at will pieces, roll the die and start a new turn. The game ends when a player reaches the top of the board (the 15th floor) or if you roll the die and that piece has already been used four times.

Your score is your single highest-scoring floor. A floor scores points equal to its level, multiplied by the number of filled spaces on that level – if your 7th floor has 9 filled spaces, it scores (7*9) 63 points. You also score a small-to-moderate bonus for unused "at-will" pieces: 6=21; 5=15; 4=10; 3=6; 2=3; 1=1. High score wins; play another turn if tied.

-description from designer

Name: Caps And Stones
Description:
Caps And Stones is a fast paced 2 player abstract game that focuses on trying to think 5 moves ahead with an ever changing play area. Games normally take 5-15 minutes to play and it only takes about 30 seconds to learn. Once you get the hang of the basic rules of play, an advanced twist on the rules is available to incorporate into your gameplay for truly mind bending games!

Caps And Stones is a print and play game that only consists of 1 playing piece and you will need to print out about 30 pieces (3 sheets of paper). One person picks the pyramid side (Caps) and the other person picks the rubble side (Stones). Then players take turns drawing from the same pile, aligning, and stacking pieces until a player gets 4 of their side lined up in a square looking down on the play area. The first one to do that wins!

Name: Territory the Card Game
Description:
Territory is a high fantasy strategy card game where players battle against one another using Champions to help secure their Territories while vanquishing their opponents’ Territories and Champions. Territory is set in a classical fantasy landscape where there are several tribes exploring the surrounding realms they find themselves in: magnificent and ancient landscapes from a past that is long forgotten. Champions will explore realms, seek out Relics, and cast Spells to combat other tribes in their quest to uncover the mysteries of the realm.

Players play the game with a deck consisting of Champion cards, Relic Cards, and Spell cards. Players also have a small separate deck called a 'Territory Deck'. The object of the game is to be the first person to get 18 points. Players get points when they destroy an opponent’s Territory, Relic, or Champion from play.

Territory is a turn-based game where players place champions on their Territories and Relics in between their Territories during their turns. Players also may play Spell cards during their turns which help improve gameplay conditions. During a player’s turn, in a distinct phase called the ‘Combat Phase’, Champions attack their opponents' Territories and Relics.

Name: Robble
Description:
Robble is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The recommended board sizes are between 5x5 and 9x9. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

				
				
					DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color. The size of a group is the number of stones in it.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty square. Then,

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to an empty square 'B' in the opposite direction, move stone 'A' to empty square 'B';

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to the edge of the board in the opposite direction, remove stone 'A', and

- for every stone 'A' that is adjacent to your newly placed stone in one direction and to another stone in the opposite direction, replace stone 'A' with a stone of the opposite color.

The game ends when the board is full. Then, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from the board until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over wins. If the board is empty, whoever made the last move before the game's end loses.

If the same board position appears for the third time with the same player to move, the game ends in a draw.

				
				
					Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

				
				
					NotesRepeating a position is very hard on a 5x5 board, and it is believed to be impossible on bigger boards.

Robble was inspired by Gekitai and Pathwayz.

-description from designer

Name: Brainfart
Description:
The trivia game where it´s right to be wrong!

In Brainfart, players are faced with 1,100 inane, ridiculous, and laugh-out-loud questions. The challenge? To blurt out the opposite of the correct answer with no time for thinking. It’s harder than it sounds! Who can keep it going the longest and who blanks out completely?

Game-play: Begin play by choosing one person to read the questions in the first round and one person to answer. The answerer should keep answering one question after another as long as they answer correctly (that is, incorrectly). Answers must come quickly, without hesitation. It's up to the reader to decide whether the answers are fast enough, but a few seconds is a good rule of thumb. Answers that take too long are considered a wrong answer and play passes to the next player.

The reader continues by asking the new answered questions from the same card, picking up with the next question. When all questions from a card have been asked, draw a new card from the pile. A new reader can take over at any time.

The player with the highest number of correct questions in a row is considered the leader. If another player beats their record, they are now the person to beat. Play for a set number of rounds, and the person with the highest score at the end wins.

Name: Stadissimo Rugby
Description:
Stadissimo Rugby is a trivia game about rugby.

Goal:
Similarly to a game of rugby, players / teams need to score tries, penalties and conversions by answering questions.

Questions cover (8 categories of 100 each):

     rules of the game of rugby
     1st French league teams
     2nd French league teams
     History, geography of cities and countries playing rugby
     5 nations tournament and International rugby
     glorious rugby players
     80/90 seasons and part of 1991
     special questions for conversion, penalties and drop kicks

Name: Chip Theory Games: Promo Pack 2018
Description:
An assortment of six chips usable with Too Many Bones, Undertow, and Hoplomachus.


     Cupid Ghillie (Valentine's Day Alternate Art, Too Many Bones)
     Dungeon Master (Hoplomachus Crowd Favor Gladiator)
     Fireworks Boomer (Independence Day Alternate Art, Too Many Bones)
     Drakkenbright Duo (Man vs. Meeple, Too Many Bones: Undertow Mech Baddie)
     Slasher Patches (Halloween Alternate Art, Too Many Bones)
     Snowbot-builder Tink (Winter Alternate Art, Too Many Bones)

Name: Hoplomachus: Dungeon Master Crowd Favor Gladiator
Description:
Contained in the 2018 CTG Promo Pack

Stats:
5 Health
1 Attack Range
2 Move Range
3 Tactical Range
Black Basic Attack Die
Ability - Rocks Fall
Alternate Attack - Everybody Dies

Name: Chip Theory Games: Promo Pack 2019
Description:
An assortment of seven chips usable with Too Many Bones, Undertow, Cloudspire, and Splice & Dice.

Contains:
· Heads/Tails Chip (Too Many Bones: Undertow)
· "Like a Florist" Tantrum (First Day of Spring Alternate Art, Too Many Bones)
·  2019 Convention Promo (Timothy lll Esq. Heirs Defector, Cloudspire)
· "Nightmare" Picket (Halloween Collection Alternate Art, Too Many Bones)
· Bloodthirsty Gila Goblin (BGG Promotion Chip, Too Many Bones and Too Many Bones: Undertow) 5pt - (Skills: Signal 2, Engulf)
· The Grint who stole Christmas (Holiday Alternate Art of Nobulous and Abomination, Too Many Bones: Splice & Dice)

Name: Too Many Bones: Bloodthirsty Gila Goblin
Description:
The Bloodthirsty Gila Goblin is a 5pt ranged baddie.

Stats:
6 HP
4 Initiative
2 Attack
1 Defense
2 Targets
Creature Type - Scales, Goblin
Skills - Signal 2, Engulf

Name: Chip Theory Games: Promo Pack 2020
Description:
An assortment of six chips usable with Too Many Bones, Undertow, and Cloudspire.

Alligator Guard (Too Many Bones)
1pt Melee Baddie
2 HP
4 Initiative
1 Attack
Creature Type - Bog
Attacks Weakest Unit
Skill: Poison 2

Furious Pandaria (Too Many Bones)
5pt Melee Baddie
6 HP
3 Initiative
X Attack
Creature Type - Beasts
Attacks Weakest Unit
Skill: Compound

Flood Dragon (Too Many Bones)
20pt Ranged Baddie
7 HP
5 Initiative
4 Attack
Creature Type - Scales
Adds 1 Extra Baddie

Claus Spire (Cloudspire)
Merc Spire Market Chip
2 Fortification Starting Upgrade
1 Source Cost 
2 Source Reward
3 Upgrade Capacity
Refinery Talent

Cloud Spider (Cloudspire)
 Swamp Landmark Chip
 5 Health
 * Attack
 4 Movement
 Poison Talent
 Spire Reward - 1 Relic Reward

Gearloc Chip - Alternate Art Stanza (Too Many Bones: Undertow)

Name: Cloudspire: Claus Spire
Description:
This market chip is available from the 2020 Promo Pack

Stats:
Merc Spire Market Chip
2 Fortification Starting Upgrade
1 Source Cost 
2 Source Reward
3 Upgrade Capacity
Refinery Talent

Name: Gunfight at O.K. Corral: October 26, 1881
Description:
Gunfight at O.K. Corral simulates the most famous gunfight in the Old West, when the Earp brothers and Doc Holliday dispatched the Clanton-McLaury gang in Tombstone, Arizona Territory, in 1881.

The solo game allows you stand in the boots of the participants (you play the lawmen, the system handles the outlaws) during this “30 shots in 30 seconds” encounter in history.  
The individual men are rated in variety of categories (gun speed, accuracy, experience, etc.) so the stage is set as you walk shoulder-to-shoulder down Fremont Street… toward destiny.

10 pages of rules, 27 counters & markers, game tables, Historical Placement map, optional rules, Designer's Notes.

NOTE: The PDF edition is identical to the edition published in Panzerschreck #18 (though it does include an extra small map, and roster sheet); those owning the Panzerschreck edition do NOT need to buy this game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel Crossover Vol. 3
Description:
The Battleworld has come to Vs. System 2PCG! Join The Grandmaster or The Collector and build your team to fight across the Domains and Terrain of Battleworld!

This year-closing, annual issue of Vs. System 2PCG is full of new play modes, mechanics and characters making sure your game will never be the same! Fight your way across the Battleworld with all new terrain that will put your skills to the test and make your deck the best.

3 new Main Characters and 4 new Supporting Characters!

New game play modes including Boss Battles and Story Mode!

Contents:
55 Cards
1 Rulesheet

Name: Stworze: Goście z daleka
Description:
The GoÅ›cie z daleka ("Visitors from afar") expansion pack introduces some of the mechanical solutions to the first edition of THE STWORZE game.

The add-on is compatible with both the basic version of the game and the add-ons: Forbidden Glade and the Beginning.

There is a new Creature in the game - Samodiva.

Name: Cringeworthy
Description:
Your next party is about to get super cringey with Cringeworthy -- the adult party game that puts you and your friends in horrible, hilarious, NOT-suitable-for-easily-offended-ears situations.

In each round, the Cringemaster reads a Situation card that sets up an open-ended scenario. Each player then chooses a Cringe card to play and reads it out loud to the group. Yes, you have to read it yourself. Got an "[Insert Name]" Cringe card? Say the name of any player other than the Cringemaster to amp up the awkwardness. Whoever makes the Cringemaster feel the most uncomfortable wins the round keeping the situation card which is worth one point. First player to earn five points wins.

Hot tip: Any card can be a winner if you sell it hard enough. Hate losing? Play an "And then ..." Cringe card plus another Cringe card from your hand to block the win. So grab your morally compromised friends and get your next game night started!

Includes 100 Situation cards and 300 Cringe cards.

Name: Cloisters
Description:
Cloisters is a simple but surprisingly deep two-player game, creating the look of a delightful complex of ancient cloisters as play progresses.

Two players take it in turns to place one of the wooden blocks following a simple rule. As new cloisters are formed the monks switch their allegiance, and only a stonemason can make a new opening in the outer wall. The player with most monks at the end wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mobile Frame Zero: Intercept Orbit
Description:
Mobile Frame Zero: Intercept Orbit is a tactical wargame of spaceships and giant robots battling across your tabletop, capturing each other's High Value Assets - and even their very warships! Build a fierce fleet of spacecraft from Lego bricks or other building toys, then INTERCEPT!

You'll need construction toys and a handful of yellow, green, blue, red, and white dice to play. You don't need Mobile Frame Zero: Rapid Attack but it will help!

—description from the publisher

This is a miniatures wargame that starts by you and your opponent building your own spacecrafts from from Lego bricks or other building toys then going on various missions and objective to determine the winner.

—user summary

Name: Catapult Feud: Siege! Expansion
Description:
Build a fortress, set up your troops, aim your ballista and DESTROY!

The War for the Floor has begun once more!

Catapult Feud: Siege! Expansion includes a new weapon (ballista), new troops, new strategy cards and new bricks so you can create even more impressive castles!

This expansion requires Catapult Feud to be played.

Warning! This is a game of construction/destruction of plastic bricks and figures... NOT your opponent, pets, or people who may foolishly pass through the field of battle! Please play fair and be careful not to hurt each other or damage anything... other than your opponent's attempt at an impenetrable fortress!

Note: This expansion was originally marketed as Catapult Kingdoms: Siege! Expansion.

—description from the publisher

Includes:
- 10 x Miniatures
- 8 x Bricks
- 4 x Gates
- 12 x Parapets
- 2 x Ballista
- 4 x Boulder Ammo
- 12 x Action Cards
- 1 x Rule Book

Name: Catapult Feud: Artificer's Tower Expansion
Description:
Build your castles, set up your troops, load your catapults and use your cunning tactics to win the day!

The War for the Floor has begun once more!

Catapult Feud: Artificer's Tower Expansion includes a new weapon (the Mighty Plunger), new Action cards, new ammunition (bee hives!!) and bricks to help you build the Artificer’s Tower!

This expansion requires Catapult Feud to play.

Warning! This is a game of construction/destruction of plastic bricks and figures... NOT your opponent, pets, or people who may foolishly pass through the field of battle! Please play fair and be careful not to hurt each other or damage anything... other than your opponent's attempt at an impenetrable fortress!

Note: This expansion was originally marketed and released as Catapult Kingdoms: Artificer's Tower Expansion.

—description from the publisher

Includes:
- 24 x Bricks
- 2 x Mighty Plunger
- 4 x Hive Ammo
- 12 x Action Cards
- 1 x Rule Book

Name: Catapult Feud: Volcano! Expansion
Description:
Build your castles, set up your troops, load your catapults and use your cunning tactics to win the day!

The War for the Floor has begun once more!

Catapult Feud: Volcano! Expansion introduces a new game mode. Place the Volcano in the middle of the battlefield, at an equal distance between players. Shuffle the Volcano cards and place them in a pile, face down, at the side of the Volcano. At the beginning of each round, the Volcano erupts, shooting random balls of fire at players.

During the Tactics Phase, instead of playing an Action card from your hand, you may reveal and resolve the top card from the Volcano deck.

Beware! Volcano cards unleash fireballs at your opponent, but sometimes they backfire!!!

This expansion requires Catapult Feud to play.

Warning! This is a game of construction/destruction of plastic bricks and figures... NOT your opponent, pets, or people who may foolishly pass through the field of battle! Please play fair and be careful not to hurt each other or damage anything... other than your opponent's attempt at an impenetrable fortress!

Note: This expansion was originally marketed as Catapult Kingdoms: Volcano! Expansion.

—description from the publisher

Includes:
- 1 x Volcano
- 4 x Fireball Ammo
- 12 x Action Cards
- 1 x Rule Book

Name: Palec boży: Freja
Description:
This is the special version of Freja, created for the Wielka Orkiestra ÅšwiÄ…tecznej Pomocy - big polish charitable event. The main emblem of WOÅšP is the heart, so the choice was obvious.

It has not only the alternative artwork, but the ability as well.

At the beginning of the Worship Phase, drop your Heart token from at least 10cm above the Map. Gain 1VP per every Prophet it touches.

-description from designer

Name: The Boshin War 1868-1869
Description:
The Boshin War 1868-1869 is a supplement for Dahlgren and Columbiad and A&AGE's Iron and Fire covering the naval side of the Boshin War, 1868-69.

The supplement contains ship data for both sets of rules for all of the warships involved in the war, and a short campaign system that focusses on the essential aspects of the war.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Boshin War & Meiji Era Rebellions

Name: No Satisfaction: Operation Hump, November 5-8, 1965
Description:
“Heavily engaged by overwhelming numbers, 1st Battalion 503rd Infantry, proved the superiority of the American Paratrooper beyond any question or doubt.”—Excerpt from 173rd Brigade’s after-action report.

The 173rd Composite Airborne Brigade was composed of units from the USA, Australia and New Zealand. Following the US intervention in April, the unit was deployed to Äá»“ng Nai Province to protect the Bien Hoa Airbase. The 173rd was a “showcase” unit that embodied what was to have been an international effort to combat the spread of Communism in South Vietnam. From the start the unit was engaged in battles with the National Liberation Front’s 9th Division for control of the province.

In November two battalions, one from the 503rd US Airborne Regiment and another from the Royal Australian Rifles, were deployed to once again “search and destroy” the elusive Viet Cong. The offensive was dubbed Operation Hump, as many of the participants optimistically felt that once this fight was over they would soon be going home. This time, however, the Communists elected to stand and fight as their brethren had done further north earlier at the A Shau Valley. What resulted was one of bloodiest and violent fights to that point in the war, sowing the first doubts among the US and Allied forces that perhaps victory for them was not “just around the corner”... Perhaps you can do as well or better?

—description from the designer

Name: Perplexus Revolution Runner
Description:
Motorized Moving 3D Maze: Perplexus Revolution Runner is a motorized, perpetually moving 3D maze! Twist, spin and turn to navigate the ball through the track and ever-changing obstacles to keep up with the maze’s movement without falling into the trench!
As the track inside moves, the obstacles are ever-changing for a constant challenge of agility and speed!

4 speeds to master: Master the first speed, then step up your difficulty level to faster speeds for even more thrilling, high-tension challenges!

—user summary
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: BIZKAIA 1937
Description:
After an impass on the Northern Front, the revel army starts in March of 1937 the offensive that will drive them to take Bilbao.
Bizkaia 1937 is a card driven solitaire game in wich you´ll have to take Bilbao in the historical period of 80 days (20 turns). Will the history be repeated or will Gen.Mola get out alive from his plane crash?, Will Goicoechea change sides with his valuable information about the Iron Belt or will you have to attack it without knowing its real strength...?
With a 24 card deck and playing a card in every turn, all the games can be different. Every new card from the deck shows what action or actions will carry out the republican side: reinforce, improve their defenses, use their poor air force or to counterattack.
After this, you´ll add the card to your hand, made up of two ones, and you will have to choose with which one of them play that turn. Each card is linked to an event and a number of operations to move, combat, replace losses and use your entire air force. Come on!

Name: Catapult Feud: Vikings! Expansion
Description:
Build your castles, set up your troops, load your catapults and use your cunning tactics to win the day!

The War for the Floor has begun once more!

Catapult Feud: Vikings! Expansion introduces a new game mode. During setup, place the Viking Longship in the battlefield at an equal distance between players. Shuffle the Viking cards and place them in a pile face down beside the Longship. Take 2 Viking warriors per player, place them in pairs at an equal distance between players. Each pair should face a different castle.

Beware! At the beginning of every round, the Viking warriors move forward, closer to the castles!

During the Tactics Phase, instead of playing an Action card from your hand, you may reveal and resolve the top card from the Viking pile.

This expansion requires Catapult Feud to play.

Warning! This is a game of construction/destruction of plastic bricks and figures... NOT your opponent, pets, or people who may foolishly pass through the field of battle! Please play fair and be careful not to hurt each other or damage anything... other than your opponent's attempt at an impenetrable fortress!

Note: This expansion was originally marketed as Catapult Kingdoms: Vikings Expansion.

-description from publisher

Includes:
- 8 x Miniatures
- 1 x Viking Longship
- 8 x Boulder Ammo
- 12 x Action Cards
- 1 x Rule Book

Name: NOM: Simon's Cat Card Game
Description:
NOM is a fast-paced, family card game for 3–8 players, ages 7+.

Just like Simon’s Cat you’re always hungry. Race to be the first player to eat all your Food, but watch out for Kitten, Mouse and Dog who’ll mess with your plans!

Take turns to play a numbered Food card, playing a higher or lower number depending on whether Simon’s Cat is pointing UP or DOWN. Play Kitten, Mouse or Dog cards to switch the order of play or force other players to draw cards. Or maybe surprise your friends with a sneaky NOM card and find out who's got the fastest reactions!

The rounds ends when one player empties their hand. Then everyone scores for how many food bowls are on their cards and gets ready for another round. The player with the lowest score when someone reaches 15 points is the winner.

Contents:

     1 Simon’s Cat card
     90 Food cards
     21 Action cards


-description from designer

Name: Grab A Pig
Description:
Players simultaneously pass cards from their hands to their neighbours in the hope of acquiring a full matching set. When a player completes a set, they must grab a pig from the centre of the table. At this point all other players must also grab a pig, but there is always one pig less than the number of players. Failing to grab a pig kicks that player out of the game, and leaves the remaining players to battle it out in the next round. Last player standing is the winner.

Components: Soft Plastic Pigs, 1 Pencil, 4 Rule cards, 1 double sided Score Pad, 24 game cards (4 of each of the 6 characters).

Name: Ride the Rails: Australia & Canada
Description:
The Ride the Rails: Australia & Canada expansion features a double-sided game board of Australia and Canada:


    In Australia, new long distance hexes are available to connect far away cities that provide massive bonuses. The rugged terrain reduces your build capacity even further!



    In Canada, multiple clusters of cities await your connections. Toronto provides a bonus for all railroad companies connecting there.


Both maps feature new ways in which the six railroad companies are introduced in the game!

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Wissen & Quizzen: Menschlicher Körper
Description:
In this trivia card game about the human body, the 3 assistants Kara Körper, Käpt'n Quizzo, and Anett Quartett guide through 3 different game modes.

Knowledge: Learn about the human body with 26 different cards.

Trivia game: All players answer questions and score victory points. The player with the most points wins the game.

Card Game

For all games the Tiptoi pen is required. The cards can be combined with any of other Game of the "Tiptoi: Wissen & Quizzen" series for more variety of trivia themes.

Name: Snack Attack
Description:
Hungry dinos everywhere! Fast-paced and easy-to-learn, steal snacks in this family-friendly, competitive card game for 2-4 players!

How Its Played:
Players draw 3 cards consisting of food and flavors. Players then take turns stacking the cards on dishes. Once enough food is on the plate you claim it as yours.

Players can try to sabotage each other by playing Picky Eater cards like bitter and sour, or  use sweet and spicy to protect their own snacks.

Cards like Rex and Momnisaur also add variety to the game by returning all food to the deck, or forcing players to share their food.

Scoring and Winning:
Every dish that is claimed is scored at the end of a round. Snacks are each worth 1 point, and everything else is worth 0. The winner of the game is the player with the most points after 3 rounds.

Name: Fotozoo
Description:
Fotozoo is a very simple and family fun game, here, you will enter the Zoo to demonstrate your skills as a photographer, fulfilling challenges according to the characteristics of the animals, such as their habitat, species, diet, size, etc.

It is a real-time game, that is, all players participate at the same time and against the clock. Whoever collects the most points wins. As there are no turns, all the players play against the time, they can change their animal cards with the animal cards on the table or with other players in order to complete the set described in the objective card to win those points.

-description from designer

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Suzerain
Description:
Special Promo for the BGG Geek Store, featuring a familiar face.

Suzerain = When losing 1 or 2 Virtue from constructing/adorning Buildings at the Guildhall or hiring Apprentices at the Workshop, gain 1 Gold.
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Paladins of the West Kingdom: Suzerain
Description:
Special Promo for the BGG Geek Store, featuring a familiar face.

Suzerain = If gaining suspicion rewards no tax, gain 2 silver from the supply.
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Suzerain
Description:
Special Promo for the BGG Geek Store, featuring a familiar face.

Suzerain (Hero) = Ongoing ability: Do not gain corruption when playing criminals to your player board.
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Capital Lux 2: Generations – The Expansion
Description:
This expansion includes 4 new power tiles:

- Intruder: The Intruder power makes you play a rebel card in any capital district without triggering the power.
- Vector: The Vector power makes you draw a negative card into your hand.
- Architect: Take one Architect tile and add it to your home base sheet. Whenever you complete the mission on the tile, you receive 2 gold and discard the tile.
- Experimenter: This power makes you draw one Experimenter card into your hand. A 1-valued card makes you trigger a capital power even when you play it in your home base, while a 7-valued card never triggers any power.

In addition to this, the expansion also includes components for a 5th player, as well as 4 new Mentalist tiles to add to the base game.

Name: Speedy Party
Description:
It's a last-minute costume party among friends, and everyone is rushing to the nearest costume shop. Each person is trying to gather the pieces of their choice before ducking into the fitting room. Let the party begin!

GOAL OF THE GAME

Find all parts for the most costumes in order to accumulate the most points (buttons) after four rounds. A complete costume comprises three cards (costume + headdress + accessory) or a single card for the bumblebee, bunny, and sumo.

HOW TO PLAY

The players count together, "1,2,3" and simultaneously reveal the top card from their stacks, and place it face-up on the table.

If there are no complete costumes visible amongst all the cards, everyone count "1,2,3" and flips a new card, placing it beside the cards already visible. Thus, the number of cards visible gradually increases.

As soon you see a complete costume, tap the bell, and announce the name of the costume you saw. If your answer is correct, you take the three cards that compose this costume, and place them face-up in front of you.

At the end of each round, you earn one button per costume you collected.

Whoever has the most buttons at the end of the fourth round wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Munchkin: Misch oder stirb!
Description:
Four mini-expansions for popular Munchkin settings

You play all imaginable settings of Munchkin? Here you get supplies: 30 cards each for four of the most popular. A colorful mix awaits you:


     As any true Munchkin knows, rules are meant to be broken. And Munchkin Cheats (for Munchkin) has been created for exactly that purpose.



     Time for a thorough investigation with Munchkin Cthulhu: Sanity Check (for Munchkin Cthulhu)! Because being a cultist is a lot harder than is commonly believed.



     When the zombies are making the streets unsafe, no one would think of hiding in a graveyard, would they? Granted, it is innovative ... as you'll learn in Munchkin Zombies: Grave Mistakes (for Munchkin Zombies)!



     Life in a spaceship is boring. Going down to the planet, that's what shreds! But watch out in Star Star Munchkin: Landing Party (for Star Munchkin) that the reception doesn't get too hot!


You must own at least the corresponding base games, and you can add them to each set. Or maybe you want to throw all the setting games together because you like Cthulhu-Science Fiction-Kung-Fu-Space Pirate Dungeon Adventures with Zombies!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Island of Dr. Moreau
Description:
Classic literature/movies characters like the invisible man, the werewolf, the vampire, the phantom of the opera, Dr. Jekyll and others join forces in this cooperative game. Their objective is to take down Dr. Moreau, a brilliant but mad scientist who retired in a lost island to carry out atrocious experiments on humans and animals in an effort to create, in his lab, a super-being.
The game offers an unprecedented approach to traditional board game-play where technology, in the form of a very intuitive Web-APP, is introduced. Besides performing many random game functions a new very exiting feature was created: the Map Maker. As the game progresses the A.I. will indicate which new Map-Tiles are to be added to the Map Puzzle. This way, players will have to re-adapt their strategies according to the configuration of the map. All maps will be different and the chances that you will play a map twice is highly unlikely. Besides this, the Web-APP allows players to play (each with their own board game) remotely and in real-time. 
Character and weapons upgrades, an underground labyrinth , over 50 weapons and inventory items, many actions to chose from, Attack / Defense tactics, the need to manage physical as well as internal resources and a compelling story-line are the main ingredients of this cyberpunk horror cooperative board game that is the first of an incredible trilogy where the line that separates humans from animals is blurred. Which side are you on?

—description from the designer

Name: BoxBox Racing Game
Description:
Welcome to Paddock! BoxBox it´s a game that allows you to vividly feel the experience of managing a Formula 1 Squad!

Prepare your Formula 1 to race in a variety of tracks and weathers, push your luck by picking up random cards that will set the pace of the race and recharge your tire stack by defeating opponents in duels.
You´ll be in charge of two cars in your squad, remember that you beat this race by earning points and not by finishing first.
Press your luck with a fun and simple mech of roll and move. From 2 to 5 players.

—description from the designer (translated)

Bienvenidos al Paddock! BoxBox es un juego de carreras que te permite vivir la experiencia de dirigir una escudería de Formula 1!  
Prepara to formula uno para correr en una variedad de pistas y climas, prueba tu suerte recogiendo cartas aleatorias que marcaran el ritmo de la carrera y recarga tu pila de neumáticos al derrotar a tus oponentes en duelos. 
Estarás a cargo de dos autos en tu escuadrón, recuerda que ganas esta carrera consiguiendo mas puntos y no terminando primero.

—description from the designer

Name: La regata della Repubbliche Marinare
Description:
La regata della Repubbliche Marinare is a classic Italian game about the Regatta of the Historical Maritime Republics; a historical race established in 1955 between Amalfi, Pisa, Genoa and Venice.
4 rowing crews from each of the Republic compete against each other.

Name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Man vs Meeple Island Set
Description:
5 extra island cards that have to be shuffled into their respective decks. The cards are marked ‘Man vs Meeple 01 - 05’.

Was part of the Man vs Meeple season 3 kickstarter campaign

Name: Monopoly: Tarn-et-Garonne
Description: Limited edition (1062 copies) of the classic Monopoly game themed on the department of Tarn-et-Garonne in southwestern France.

Name: Rugby Challenger
Description:
Rugby Challenger is a game about the sport of rugby.

Gameplay:
Players (alone or in team) need to score points in the in-goal area of the opposing team. They progress similarly to the game of goose with a dice, boxes, and trivia cards with questions on rugby, to pass the obstacles.
Questions cover the game of rugby, its history, French and international teams...

Name: Monopoly: Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks
Description:
The object and rules of the game remain the same.

Bankrupt your mates, buy up big and the last man, woman or child standing, or at least holding the cash, wins.

It’s the game of Monopoly as we all know it.

But the difference is, this is Sharks Monopoly where players from the Sharks Team of the Half Century are there for the buying and selling, the travel spaces represent Sutherland Shire transport, you can be forced to pay membership fees and you accumulate grandstands and stadiums rather than houses and hotels.

The age-old board game has been ‘Sharkified’.
 Sharks legends such as Ettingshausen, Rogers, Miller, Bishop and Pierce are represented, alongside current stars Fifita, Holmes, Lewis and Graham.

It’s the Monopoly you know, with a distinct Sharks look and feel.

- description from the publisher's website

Name: Snehvide Brætspil
Description:
A dice racing game. For 42 squares the dwarfs have to get behind to reach Snow White and dodge dangers.

A small kids board game.

A dice is rolled in succession and moved forward accordingly.
If you land on a square that ends in 2, you go back 2 squares. If it ends in 6, you go back 6 spaces.
On the 10, the witch field, is suspended.
On a field, only one dwarf may stand. If it is occupied, you cannot move and remain standing. The goal is to roll the dice exactly on the target field. Whoever succeeds in such a roll, wins.

Scope of play:
1 game board with the forest.
4 game cones
1 dice
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White
